data: ORTHO Fractured Hip Pre - Operative Order (Regional)
Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
Hip fracture patients: Surgery must be completed within 48 hours of first admission in BC
Once on admission, then q4h and PRN

q12h, As per hip fracture pathway
On admission, then q4h and PRN
Chlorhexidine cloth wash to whole body where accessible on the night prior to and day of surgery
Place warming blankets on patients 30 minutes prior to surgery
BID, Patient to brush teeth and tongue within 4 hours of OR. If dependent for personal care, clean teeth and tongue BID
Deep breathing and coughing exercises 5 to 10 times per hour and PRN

Avoid catheter unless one or more indicators met:    - Retention not relieved by 2 in and out catheters   - Critically ill-accurate output required   - Advanced pressure ulcer & incontinent   - End of life comfort   - Severe pain unrelieved with analgesics
q6h, use bladder scanner if not voiding
If no catheter in situ or post catheter removal, assess patient for ability to void q6h using bladder scanner, if urine output less than 150 mL in 6 hours, notify MD/NP
If PVR greater than 300 mL, Perform straight intermittent catheterization x 3 PRN. If third catheterization is required, leave catheter in place and inform MD / NP
If urine output less than 150 mL in 6 hours
Review the most current diet order for therapeutic requirements, food texture and fluid thickness. Add anything to be carried forward to the new Diet Order
If surgery not within 8 hours, order regular diet for patient
If/when patient booked for surgery, then patient can have clear fluid diet up to 4 hours before surgery then NPO
